availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison H. Woodward (Logan County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Logan County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Jane Keel Woodward in Logan County, Kentucky, on July 11, 1842. Father of James M. Woodward, Robert M. Woodward, William B. Woodward, Nancy J. Woodward, Henry H. Woodward, Mary E. Woodward, Orlander Woodward, Samuel Woodward, Thomas Woodward, Francis Woodward, and Belle Woodward. Farmer in Logan County in 1850. Farmer in Logan County in 1860. Postmaster of Black Lick and Auburn in Logan County from May 13, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 26A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, District 1, p. 421-2.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Logan County, Auburn, p. 329B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Logan County Marriages, Film #002134965, p. 357 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, Logan County, p. 124 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Harrison H. Woodward (1 Dec 1816-16 Nov 1906)," Memorial #123314536, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/123314536 (accessed September 8, 2020).
